rootCause: An employee with elevated privileges opened a phishing email, allowing the Shamoon malware to enter the network.
impact: Destroyed data on approximately 35,000 corporate workstations, forcing the company to shut down its internal network and resort to manual processes.
description: The Shamoon virus was a destructive wiper attack on the world's largest oil company, Saudi Aramco. The malware was designed purely for sabotage, overwriting the master boot records of infected machines and replacing data with a burning American flag image, crippling the company's business operations.

sources.title: The inside story of the biggest hack in history
